== Introduction ==
One of the most important aspects of any Computer Software is the <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_documentation | Software Documentation]]</nowiki> Process.

The '''Documentation Team''' is a group of community volunteers responsible for writing, editing, and updating the Documentation and Wiki System of <nowiki>[[UbuntuGNOME | Ubuntu GNOME]]</nowiki>.

== Join Us ==
You can send a request to <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntugnome-wiki-docs | join the team on Launchpad]]</nowiki>.

=== Introduce yourself ===
Do not be shy. Please send an email to the mailing list of the Documentation Team and introduce yourself.

== How to help ==
* First of all, please create your own Wiki Page and before that, you need to have an account on Launchpad - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/Community#Ubuntu_GNOME_Official_Members | Here is HOWTO do that]]</nowiki>. This will help you to make your first step with the Wiki and Documentation System.

* Once you create your own page, start to fill it up with your details and learn step by step how to edit a Wiki Page - <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HelpContents | This]]</nowiki> will help you.

* When you feel comfortable with the Wiki System, try to have a look at: <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/WikiMap | Ubuntu GNOME Wiki Map]]</nowiki>. The Wiki Map of Ubuntu GNOME is a unique index of each and every page under https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME and this index is '''the most important page''' for Ubuntu GNOME Wiki & Docs Team. '''Please''' make sure to bookmark it if you are part of this team.

* If you are in doubt, ALWAYS ask on the mailing list.

=== Subscribe to a Wiki Page ===

Subscribing to the a Wiki Page will make it easier for you as a '''Wiki Editor''' to follow up with the changes other members are making. You will be notified with each and every update on a specific Wiki Page, which makes remaining in the loop easier.

* '''You need to be logged in to the Wiki Area (using your Launchpad Account) so that you can subscribe to any page'''.

<nowiki>[[File:subtowiki.png]]</nowiki>

<<BR>>

=== Adding Comment ===
Kindly be advised that you are required to add 'comments' after each and every edit you do on the Wiki Pages so that everyone will be aware of the changes you have made. Whenever someone needs to go back to the history of any Wiki Page, adding comments will help them to understand, in summary and few seconds, what happened to that page instead of going through the whole page or one section :) if this not clear, please ask on the mailing list.

== Ubuntu GNOME Wiki & Docs Map ==
=== Wiki Map ===
To make life easier for everyone and to have a full list/index of all the Wiki Pages that Ubuntu GNOME Team has, we have created a Wiki Map - Please see: <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuGNOME/WikiMap | Ubuntu GNOME Wiki Map]]</nowiki>.

* If you want to contribute and don't really know where to get started, have a look at the Wiki Map
* Any Wiki Page to be added or removed, the Wiki Map must be updated as well
* To have a quick reference of all the pages that we have, you need to check the Wiki Map

'''Please, make sure to keep an eye on that Wiki Map - bookmark it.'''
